page.title: 16FINSTOCK CHURCH
page.content: Originally a {Chapel_of ease} of Charlbury.Consecrated in {1842.} Parish registers began in {1860,}when Finstock became a separate parish. Present choir and sanctuary (in elaborate {Gothic Revival }style) added in {1906.} Pulpit given in memory of Francis Churchill,died 1866. East window (Crucifixion with St. Mary and St. John) signed with { {"wheatsheaf"}mark of {Kempe}, well_known 19th century stain glass artist. End window has coat_of_arms of Sir Arthur du Cros, inventor of pneumatic tyre. Originally there was a Finstock tyre, produced by Dunlop. The poet {T.S.Eliot,}was baptized here 29.6.1927. A wooden lectern in memory of {Barbara Pym,}the novelist, was dedicated {3.6.1984.}Vicar conducts a 9a.m.H.C.(B.C.P) & 10a.m.H.C.(series2) alternate Sundays.
